Pre-Game Insights: Guyana will be up against some of the more experienced sides in the region in the 2024-25 season.
Guyana needs to finish in the top two to progress to the knockout stages and in the top four to avoid relegation and earn a place in the Gold Cup qualifiers.
Under Jamal Shabazz, Guyana won all five of their matches in League B last year and finished with a goal difference of +15.
Guyana go into the match off the back of a 3-1 win over Belize in their last World Cup qualifier in June.
Suriname head into a new Nations League campaign in high spirits on the back of two convincing victories in World Cup qualifying.
Since the appointment of Stanley Menzo in March, Suriname have yet to lose in three matches played across all competitions.
Suriname have only suffered one defeat in their previous seven matches played across all competitions.
Suriname have triumphed in their previous two meetings with Guyana, but have not won an away match against them since June 2008.
Others: Guyana possible starting lineup: McKenzie-Lyle; Lovell, J. Jones, Vancooten, Gordon; Ferguson, Bonds, Moriah-Welsh, Duke-McKenna; Moore, I. Jones.
Suriname possible starting lineup: Vaessen; Dijksteel, Abena, Denswil, Haps; Lonwijk, Pherai, Paal, Misidjan; Vlijter, Becker.
